main event: Three reports of unidentified flying objects observed in the Lakewood, California area on November 7, 1957.
interesting points: The objects were described as having large, bright white lights, an oblong shape, and the ability to perform level flights and disappear from sight.
The sightings lasted between 2-9 minutes and were observed by multiple witnesses, including Mr. and Mrs. ***.
The weather conditions were clear with good visibility, and there were no known aircraft in the area at the time of the sightings.
The objects were initially reported as being unidentified, but the conclusion was that they were likely balloons.
The reports were submitted in accordance with Air Force Regulation 200-2, which outlined the procedures for reporting and investigating unidentified flying objects.
sighted object: three unidentified flying objects with bright lights and an oblong shape
